articles.title: Gondwana's Secret: 390-Million-Year-Old Marine Mystery Unraveled - SciTechDaily
articles.description: During the Early-Middle Devonian period, a large landmass called Gondwana—which included parts of today's Africa, South America, and Antarctica—was located near the South Pole. Contrary to the frosty environment we see today, the climate was warmer, and eleva…
articles.content:
ByUniversity of the WitwatersrandOctober 23, 2023
During the Early-Middle Devonian, Gondwana was a warm, flooded landmass at the South Pole, home to the now-extinct Malvinoxhosan biota. New research… [+6214 chars]
